title: Ticket #4978: Starter being shutdown by startd should not wait on reconnect or lease
description:
When we enabled the code in the tests to fail a test if the condor_off -master left any daemons up, two test failed with all of their up after the 160 second waiting period. The by hand duplication is to do the following: 
Create a minimal configuration for a personal condor
run a job which creates a shadow exception
I ran a sleep job which had file transfer on and requested a transfer_output file which did not exist.
remove the job
then condor_off -master
You will see something like this in the starter for the slot which ran the job 
ReliSock::put_file_with_permissions(): Failed to stat file '/scratch/bt/bug4965/execute/dir_10249/foobar': No such file or directory (errno: 2, si_error: 1)
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) DoUpload: (Condor error code 13, subcode 2) STARTER at 128.105.121.64 failed to send file(s) to <128.105.121.64:37382>: error reading from /scratch/bt/bug4965/execute/dir_10249/foobar: (errno 2) No such file or directory; SHADOW failed to receive file(s) from <128.105.121.64:45601>
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) JICShadow::notifyJobTermination(): Sending mock terminate event.
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) JIC::transferOutput() failed, waiting for job lease to expire or for a reconnect attempt
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) Returning from CStarter::JobReaper()
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) Got SIGTERM. Performing graceful shutdown.
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) ShutdownGraceful all jobs.
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) condor_read() failed: recv(fd=6) returned -1, errno = 104 Connection reset by peer, reading 5 bytes from <128.105.121.64:49193>.
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) IO: Failed to read packet header
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) Lost connection to shadow, waiting 1200 secs for reconnect
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) Failed to send job exit status to shadow
04/01/15 14:16:47 (pid:10249) JobExit() failed, waiting for job lease to expire or for a reconnect attempt
04/01/15 14:26:47 (pid:10249) Got SIGQUIT.  Performing fast shutdown.
04/01/15 14:26:47 (pid:10249) ShutdownFast all jobs.
04/01/15 14:26:47 (pid:10249) Failed to send job exit status to shadow
04/01/15 14:26:47 (pid:10249) JobExit() failed, waiting for job lease to expire or for a reconnect attempt
We know we are going down. The starter in this case should simply go away. As it currently sits the startd waits for the MaxVacateTime before sending a SIGQUIT to starter. Starter could just have gone away. We worked around this by having a short MaxVacateTime
remarks:
2015-Apr-02 14:46:07 by tannenba:

I am thinking the above is correct behavior, because by default condor_off does a graceful shutdown, and a graceful shutdown is supposed to honor all guarantees made to the job for things like retirement time and job leases.

If you reproduced exactly the same as above but issued a condor_off -master -fast instead of just condor_off -master, does the shutdown happen immediately? I hope it does. Please confirm.

bt: Yes

2015-Apr-02 15:27:42 by tannenba:
Ok, I am resolving this as it appears to be working as documented. For the test suite case, seems like you want to explicitly perform a condor_off -master -fast.
